description: Of North Germanic origin, related to Swedish mopa (“to sulk”),  Danish måbe. Compare also German muffen, French moue.

examples: When she gets upset, she has a little mope, and then gets over it.

entries.meaning: (pornography industry) A bottom feeder who "mopes" around a pornography studio hoping for his big break and often does bit parts in exchange for room and board and meager pay.
examples: The porn industry is many things. Subtle is not one of them. So when Porn Inc. went searching for a job title for people like Stephen Hill, the choice was "mope." It's based on the off-camera life of these fringe actors, hangers-on who mope around the studios hoping for a bit role, which if they're lucky might bring them $50 plus food — and the chance to have sex with a real, live woman.[1]

verbs.description: mope (third-person singular simple present mopes, present participle moping, simple past and past participle moped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To carry oneself in a depressed, lackadaisical manner; to give oneself up to low spirits; to pout, sulk.
